discourse_list.title: UNI buyback from market using Uniswap 0.3% fees

content.content: I guess as the holders of UNI token, we do need to see buyback support from Uniswap team. How about confirm to use 20% from all received Uniswap income (project income, not liquidity providers fees) to buy and burn UNI (to grow UNI price?) In simple words, current revenue flow:  Get fees pay to liquidity providers keep rest as profit Uniswap - 20% from this flow to buy and burn.
content.GPT-summary: The author proposes that 20% of Uniswap's income should be used to buy and burn UNI tokens to increase their value. The post is an explanation of the proposal and a suggestion for the Uniswap team to support it. A 3rd party could give constructive criticism on the feasibility and potential impact of the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Süper olur.Fiyat çok düştü kimse degersiz bir şey almak istemez.
I’m very interested in something along these lines.

“UNI buyback from market using Uniswap 0.3% fees” First of all without fees you will not have liquidity providers and distribution UNI to every scam token pool is not possible. Fee that can be switched on is 0.05% ( at yesterday’s volume the fee would be around $140,000 daily)     oleksiivinogradov1:  I guess as the holders of UNI token, we do need to see buyback support from Uniswap team. How about confirm to add 20% from all received Uniswap fees to UNI-ETH pool (to grow UNI price?)   Adding more liquidity to UNI pair will not grow UNI price. Buying back and burning UNI will grow the price exponentially through compounding effect.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: @Uni3 Agreed. I re-write a proposal to clarify, from where to get money for buy and burn. Check now, if you satisfied p.s. @Uni3 @Natsuka @mcactivos  - can u share with friends with post to get more comments?
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

content.content: Have in mind that fee switch can’t be turned on for 180 days. There is already discussion on the same topic at proposals. [POLL] How Would We Structure a Fee Reward?

I mean all cumulative fees, which Uniswap received after pay all liquidity pool holders e.t.c. for all tokens, not just UNI. I mean Uniswap general income as % from all fees. Let me re-phrase the proposal to clear this point.

content.content: Buy and burn is not efficient in the long term ww.placeholder.vc/blog/2020/9/17/stop-burning-tokens-buyback-and-make-instead
i think buy and send to treasury for more uses is better , maybe with vesting period.
agree, project serum buy & burn $SRM many times but nothing happen.

@Theo - for you too It very depends on a project tokenomics and how they sell reserved tokens to market. This is why this strategy looks “not efficient”. If the Uniswap team will hold its own tokens - this way will work well.

content.content: It can anyway drop down a rate. Vesting can help, but with big time, like one year.

Buy and Burn isn’t healthy for UNI and wouldn’t effect sustainable growth in valuation. Fees on the other hand attract LPs and oils the wheels of the ecosystem, and thus shouldn’t be misappropriated. Let the value of UNI grow organically with time as adoption advances.

Think u misunderstood what I mean was have a governance system similiar to curve where we lock uni for long term duration for the .05% fees that way holders would benefit more also would need a voting type token for when u freeze uni to be able to vote

content.content: LP providers play an important role. UNISWAP needs to entice them. It is good to have LP whales to stabilize price fluctuations of any given trade-able asset. The fees that UNISWAP generates from the LP of 0.25% tax  and the additional 0.05% UNI token incentive was a way to entice LP to UNISWAP? Yes but perhaps a balance must be reached to avoid dumps of UNI because otherwise without the right tokenomics a loss of real value will be faced by uni as opportunity cost. It is not clear as several replies above show that a BB&B is enough to stabilize UNI value let alone provide any real increase in value. If the UNI token doesn’t do anything, and is not even enticing to LP, then it is effectively useless.  This is why I propose the following, and invite discussion from the link therein: https://snapshot.page/#/uniswap/proposal/QmWL6jSeYRKzEaS37GjV96b8sFpLFnmHJG84qvek2speAM
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: While I understand the sentiment here, this is an unrealistic ask to make of the core team. Given how cautious the team needs to be about governance, there is zero chance that buybacks could happen. Instead, the better route here would to be discussing a Uniswap protocol fee, currently set to 0% but able to be switched on to $0.05% at any time. See this post under ‘Path to Sustainability’.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: This is a good hope getting better and better
hahaha this is a bad designed poll with zero statistical relevance. It shouldn’t be take account.

I’m completely against this proposal. Buy back UNI is a terrible decision. All profits from LP should go directly to improving the protocol. The decision to repurchasing UNI tokens is only a completely greedy choice that only is going to decelerate the grow of uniswap. Using that profit to grow is a much better choice. Also, the UNI token isn’t money and does not claim to be. It’s more a kind of share. Diminish UNI token supply has little or null impact in long term price. The market cap of UNI token will tend to a value independently of what the supply is.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party giving entirely negative feedback on proposal

content.content: How about a staking program where Uni Holders get a small portion of fees? Only people involved in the community would be rewarded.

This runs the risk of inviting shills, shitposters, and other low-quality posting. A mechanism for tipping people, or using a reputation system like discourse currently has might work, but then you’d be dealing with bots manipulating a reputation system. Tipping on the forum doesn’t seem likely to be a popular activity, it’s very dependant on trust, ie. I don’t have much faith that people would tip me for my posts, so why should I tip others?
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal
None of the topics listed match
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Just to clear up  any confusion I meant staking in the sense that Uni Holders can deposit their funds on Uniswap and receive a portion of all trading fees. This would incentivize long term holding and stewardship of Uni tokens. If we took just a quarter of LP fees at 4Billion in volume per day, that is like 6 cents per Uni token. Smart money would hold Uni and be motivated to grow the trading volume as that would increase the value of Uni. People with Uni just sitting in wallets wouldn’t be rewarded.
